author: Upstairs_Moment_1043
body: hey first of all, OP, i‚Äôm sorry about your parents. second, this is not something to stress about. most people who come into money immediately hire a financial planner to help them. if you like to ‚Äútough it out on your own‚Äù (a thing i would not recommend), put a majority of that money in a safe investment (a boiler plate Roth IRA, maybe a CD, a good 4.5% savings account) and then keep a little bit to play with if you trust your investing skills. if investing is not a skill you already have, you do not want to gamble all your money away. start small, learn the basics, and above all else protect yourself. i know losing your parents is hard

author: MrKillerKiller_
body: Noooo. Maybe 5% on BTC when the market is in bear status in like a year. The rest in a standard mutual fund with SPX and all that in the bag. Its the top of the bull run, the highest of speculation price ranges until end of year. Summer is always the worst price action. Just no. Set something up through vanguard or fidelity. Crypto is speculative and it all is just bitcoin profits flowing into the rest. Do not get fooled into thinking crypto is more than a cycle swing trade. When bear markets stop pulling back 80%+ every cycle you‚Äôll slowly see it become more of a traditional investment. It is not something to throw life savings amounts into. Absolutely not

author: Fulvio55
body: Yes, walletgenerator has been compromised twice that we know of.  In one instance there was a clone site that phoned home with all the wallets it generated. We mounted a concerted effort to flood it with millions of wallets until it was taken down, which took a few days.  In the other case there was a bug where it was reusing the same wallets repeatedly. That one was fixed fairly quickly as well.  This is an open source project, and anyone could download the code and run it in preference to using the live site.  I generally advise people to generate thousands of bulk wallets and to let them stew for as long as possible before using any of them randomly. For immediate needs, coinb.in will generate single wallets which you can do offline on your own copy, not the live site.  I think you may have fallen victim to one of the two instances above. I think a blanket warning isn‚Äôt warranted though. All wallets are identical, and how you generate them is irrelevant. The risk is not in the methodology but in someone else having access to the keys either through compromised code, in transit, or through malware on your devices.  I‚Äôm sorry for your loss. Did you have other wallets from the same time as well? And were they bulk or a single wallet?

author: liquid_at
body: Any reason you believe the most boring and least bullish period of the year is going to see an ATH?  I mean... it's a weird year and everything, but without an argument it feels like a lot of copium. We have about 2 weeks left for the traditional bull market and Mid-May is traditionally bearish. Even extended, we might get 4 weeks where a run could happen.   Personally, if we do not see a run this month, I would not expect to see one before november or january.

body: april was the time and still is. But anyone who bought for the april run who isn't in profit right now, would want people buying to get the necessary liquidity to sell.   I'm highly suspicious of anyone saying that summer will be bullish. It would be the first summer in the history of perpetual markets where we'd get a high.
